Key Arguments: The Bill is fundamentally against democratic principles and freedom of speech.
It gives power to an elite group to decide what is misinformation, which is prone to abuse.
Historical examples show that censorship can lead to disastrous outcomes.
There is a lack of trust in politicians and elites to use these powers fairly.
The Bill could stifle necessary debate and dissenting voices.
Notable Quotes: This Bill strikes directly at this unique Aussie ‘freedom’.
Blind Freddy could tell you that this is a recipe for disaster.
Self styled arbiters of truth who deny people the freedom to hear alternative views or to speak their views have no place in our land.
To be honest, this Bill is so bad that I have to question the motives of those promoting it.
